page.title: 05Romiley Precinct (morning)
page.content: It was a dreary,wet and cold day.The road was packed with buses and cars. The beeping of the Pelican crossing went on and off like a record. Most of the people were clutching umbrellas rushing to get out of the rain. It probably wouldn't be as busy if it wasn't a bank holiday on Monday next. Birches the local Greengrocer had their large selection of fruit displayed outside the shop.There were Dutch tomatoes which were 68p per pound,Spanish strawberries at 58p per punnet and Italian Golden Delicious apples at 32p per pound.The local theatre Romiley Forum were advertising many forthcoming shows. Gateways the local Supermarket which sells most things, was packed with people as usual.
